metadata.title: Persona Card UI with Copy Button

story.tasks: - [ ] Persona card component (AC: 1–4) - [ ] Implement Streamlit function rendering card layout per UX spec. - [ ] Include avatar icons (maybe emoji or small PNG) per persona. - [ ] Copy button (AC: 2) - [ ] Use Streamlit `st.button` or custom JS to copy text; show toast via `st.success`. - [ ] Handle keyboard activation (Enter/Space). - [ ] Secondary hooks (AC: 3) - [ ] Display hook badges; clicking sets “selected hook” and updates preview text. - [ ] Empty state + data refresh (AC: 5) - [ ] Show instructions when persona service returns 404. - [ ] Provide “Refresh data” button to re-run query.

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. Persona cards display: persona avatar/icon, name, goal snippet, stack snapshot (WAF/CDN), drift/downtime/attack scores with badges, freshness warning, and main hook text. 2. “Copy message” button copies the story prompt + citation to clipboard, showing a “Copied!” toast and subtle state change for 2 seconds. 3. Secondary hooks appear as badges or bullet list items; clicking them updates the main hook preview. 4. Cards respect Midnight Intelligence theme, spacing, and accessibility requirements (focus outlines, readable colors). 5. Empty-state: if no persona data exists, the panel explains how to run enrichment CLI; when data exists, cards update instantly.

doc.title: Persona Card UI with Copy Button
doc.snippet: As GTM users, we want persona cards inside Streamlit that mirror the UX spec—including avatars, scores, hooks, and copy-to-clipboard buttons— so storytelling becomes frictionless once data is available.

story-context.constraints:
- Reuse `generate_persona_view()` output from Story 3.1; no duplicate logic. - Keep layout responsive (two cards per row on desktop, stacked on mobile). - Optionally cache persona data to avoid repeated DB hits.
### Project Structure Notes
- Consider `ui/components/persona_card.py` helper to avoid clutter in `ui/app.py`. - Ensure CSS/JS stays minimal since Streamlit doesn’t allow heavy DOM manipulation.
